note: As an infant, Norman Ferguson was rescued by Benedictine monks from the spreading branches of a banyan tree after a freak tornado in Namibia. After spending his first 12 years in the monastery, he went to sea on a Peruvian anchovy trawler, where he spent many carefree days reading from the captainâ€™s extensive library of Norse mythology (in the original Sanskrit). Later he opened a chain of unsuccessful dogsled repair shops in the Mississippi delta.
